An odd thing happened tonight. In Vancouver Canada, widely considered to be amongst the most peaceful places in the world, riots and fighting broke out. Even a car was lit on fire. The government had to deploy it's pathetic riot control which consists of nothing more than a guy named Blake dressed up in full motorcycle attire complete with crash helmet and armed with a water sprayer. That tactic may work on cats, but riotting Canadians? Maybe not.
 
 The reason? Vancouver lost the hockey game to Boston. My question is why the hell does it matter if one team loses a sporting event to another team? Why favour one group of athletes over another group simply depending on where the team is based? Why get so steamed up about a game that one ends up conducting what some would consider mild terrorism? I will never understand sports fandom. In the case of hockey, I'm not a fan, but I see nothing wrong with it. But at the same time, I hate it more than anything because of the absurdly obnoxious fans we have here in Canada. We should be chill like what our reputation would lead you to believe.
 
 Despite our clean bill of safety, this sort of thing happens more often than you think. We loves us some riots. A few years ago at the G8 summit in...
